input_text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to add a signature in adobe reader?
input_text.Response A: Sure, I can give you step-by-step instructions. First, open Adobe Reader and click the “File” menu. Then, click “Options”. On the left side of the window that appears, click the “Signature” tab. In the “Add Signature” field, type the text that you want to appear as your signature. Click “OK” and then “Save” to save your changes.
input_text.Response B: Sure, you can sign a document in Adobe Reader by clicking the Sign button in the Document menu, and then following the steps to add your signature.  This will create a new signature in the document, which you can then save and use to sign other documents.  You can also add a signature in Adobe Reader by selecting the Create Signature button in the Signature menu, and then signing the document using your digital signature.  You can also sign a document in Adobe Reader by selecting the Add Signature button in the Tools menu, and then adding your signature using the tool.

label_annotations.factors_a: Response A is factually correct as per google dependant which version of Adobe you would use, however this response is very short and only covers one way to answer the question
label_annotations.factors_b: Response B is a full answer to the question and is factually correct according to google. The response is very concise and easily understood
